text: {{Infobox writer | name = Selma Lagerlöf | image = Selma Lagerlöf.jpg | imagesize = | caption = Selma Lagerlöf, 1909 | pseudonym = | birth_name=Selma Ottilia Lovisa Lagerlöf | birth_date = | birth_place = Mårbacka, Sweden | death_date = | death_place = Mårbacka, Sweden | occupation = Writer | nationality = Swedish | awards = }} Selma Ottilia Lovisa Lagerlöf (; born 20 November 1858, dead 16 March 1940, She was 81 years old. Was a Swedish writer. In 1909, she was awarded the Nobel Prize in Literature becoming the first woman to do so. She is mostly known for her children's book Nils Holgerssons underbara resa genom Sverige (The Wonderful Adventures of Nils).
